positive.mainPoint: Good scholarship that includes the following
subPoints: citing source of information and knowledge
excellent job on citations of important libraries and sources of knowledge
consistent formatting of references

positive.mainPoint: Good writing and communication that includes the following
subPoints: complete sentences used when appropriate (e.g. within Markdown cells)
correct English spelling
consistent usage of the English language (i.e. not mixing in non-English words)
clean, concise and understandable sentences

neutral.mainPoint: Generally good citing of information, but with a few issues that include
subPoints: being careful when citing websites - when possible cite peer-reviewed papers or academic books
when citing websites, one should include the date visited
take care to provide the references with the same formatting structure

neutral.mainPoint: Generally good writing and communication, with the following small issues
subPoints: a few incomplete sentences when not appropriate (e.g. within Markdown cells)
a few misspelled English words
some mixing of English and German words
a few sentences that were not concisely written or understandable
As a university student, you should be citing sources of knowledge. This is something that you will need to do for your thesis.

negative.mainPoint: Poorly citing information, which includes the following
subPoints: not citing Python3 libraries that were used:
not citing sources for information used (e.g. equations, datasets):

negative.mainPoint: No (or very little) communication of ideas or thoughts
subPoints: Communicating your thoughts and ideas is important (e.g. providing context for the code, clarification of workflow).

negative.mainPoint: Poor writing and communication that includes the following
subPoints: no context given for what problem was being solved
no presentation of thoughts or ideas concerning the workflow (or solution)
lots of incomplete sentences when full sentences would have been appropriate ((e.g. within Markdown cells)
several misspelled English words
significant mixing of English and German words
sentences were not concisely written, or not easily understood
